definition: to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

sentences.english: Work harder to build an honest government, punish graft and corruption
sentences.chinese: 加强廉政建设，惩治贪污腐败。

sentences.english: His five-year-old son thinks he’s a private eye who catches bad guys.
sentences.chinese: 他五岁的儿子以为他是个专门惩治坏人的私家侦探。

sentences.english: It would be corrupting discipline to leave him unpunished.
We will establish a system of legal accountability and punishment in which powers, responsibilities and interests are in close correspondence.
sentences.chinese: 建立权责利相对应的法律追究惩治体系。

sentences.english: All day long I have been plagued; I have been punished every morning.
sentences.chinese: 因为我终日遭灾难，每早晨受惩治。

sentences.english: The strengthening of the supervision of power is the key to punish corruption.
sentences.chinese: 惩治腐败，关键是加强权力监督。

sentences.english: And why should Allah not punish them, when they have barred others from the Sacred Mosque, although they were not its guardians?
sentences.chinese: 他们阻止别人入禁寺的时候，真主怎能不惩治他们呢？

sentences.english: And the elders of that city shall take that man and chastise him;
sentences.chinese: 本城的长老要拿住那人，惩治他。

sentences.english: We will conscientiously carry out all tasks and measures for punishing and preventing corruption.
sentences.chinese: 认真落实惩治和预防腐败的各项任务和措施。

sentences.english: Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors.
sentences.chinese: 万军之神耶和华以色列的神阿，求你兴起，惩治万邦。

sentences.english: We have to winnow out and punish these foolish ideas.
sentences.chinese: 我们要簸出，惩治那些愚蠢的想法。

sentences.english: He also promised to punish corruption and address China’s growing wealth gap.
sentences.chinese: 他同时保证会惩治腐败并承认日益增长的贫富差距。

sentences.english: I gave your children blows to no purpose;
sentences.chinese: 我责打你们的儿女是徒然的，他们不受惩治。

sentences.english: Was a Cheng to cure apt neglect too fair Sun 12 Chinese officers.
sentences.chinese: 就是惩治了怠慢了也只是损了一两个汉官。

sentences.english: Punishing corruption is the right of ours entrusted by peoples.
sentences.chinese: 惩治腐败是我们的本分。

sentences.english: It would be corrupting military discipline to leave him unpunished.

definition: to punish (someone)/to take disciplinary action against (someone)
lit. kill one to warn a hundred (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
in order to warn against following bad examples (idiom)/as a warning to others
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to punish according to the law/to bring to justice
excessively tolerant/to overindulge (sb)/overly conciliatory/to seek appeasement at any price
